meanings.definition: An act or instance of judging wrongly or unfairly.
meanings.sent1: Her misjudgments led to misunderstandings among her friends.
meanings.sent2: The team's misjudgments cost them the game.
meanings.sent3: His misjudgments in choosing gifts always ended in funny mix-ups.
meanings.sent4: The misjudgments of the weather forecast left everyone unprepared for the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's misjudgments in grading made the students frustrated and confused.

meanings.definition: A mistake in judgment or perception.
meanings.sent1: The misjudgments in his calculations resulted in a failed experiment.
meanings.sent2: She regretted her misjudgments in trusting the wrong person.
meanings.sent3: The misjudgments in his fashion choices always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The misjudgments of the detective delayed solving the case.
meanings.sent5: The misjudgments in his diet led to health problems later on.
